intro: Ranunculus rectistylus, commonly known as the straight-styled buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in alpine meadows and dry slopes. The species is noted for its distinctive floral structure, particularly the straight stamens that give it its common name.
